messages: ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:28): has anyone got an good ARIA examples? I'm looking for something to mimic a <select>
bac1ce548ca5670aad45c4cb8d55a02f (11:32): keithclakcouk, y mimic a select, if it is a select?
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:39): it's legacy code so i'm hoping to enrich what's there with some aria attributes
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:40): long term I will address the issue when the UI gets a overhaul
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:41): hoping I can drop some ARIA attributes into the markup for now
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:42): but finding examples is really hard
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (11:42): ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754: have u checked out jkiss's research on aria?
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:43): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: oh, do you have any links?

38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (11:43): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e, HTML5, ARIA Roles, and Screen Readers in ... - Accessible Culture - http://www.accessibleculture.org/articles/2011/04/html5-aria-2011/
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (11:45): there are mirrors from what I hear
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (11:46): paul_irish: can you ask the mods to change the topic from diveintohtml5.org to a mirror?
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:46): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: that seems to cover landmark roles - i'm looking for states and properties so I can create accessible UI controls
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (11:46): ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754: i think he has an article on tabs too
2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e (11:46): it has a few posts on aria
ca799ed8c172da533ac8f5c4654b2754 (11:47): 2cdd7064b290132617248dbfd85f740e: i'll have a look through the site. thanks :)

9cfd98e1929586efc251820fc7e5689b (12:49): does opera still pull all pages through a central server or w/e?
33efc1e92757da55a29793522ce54302 (12:50): nope, only if you use a special setting called 'turbo mode'
33efc1e92757da55a29793522ce54302 (12:50): thats for special cases where you are on a vert slow connection ... it will use a central server to compress the page and give it to you so it loads faster
